messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On April 7, DET. C. D. Roberts responded to a noise complaint at the Nightshade Club. Primary informants were Mr. Thompson, the club owner, and Ms. Stevens, a patron. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. E. F. Taylor - OPERATIONS Det. Roberts, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective G. H. Williams and Detective I. J. Nelson arrived to mediate. ADAMS 03:55 Noise Complaint Mr. Thompson reported a heated argument, and Ms. Stevens described a potential brawl. Statement. Technician Oliver recorded the scene. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Roberts Jr, Det. Williams, Det. Nelson OPERATIONS Lt. Taylor INFORMANT Stevens, Rebecca 115 Birch Lane, Nightshade, Kansas 204-935. 94400. ADAMS 03:55 Noise Complaint By 4:30 AM, Detectives Roberts, Williams, and Nelson, with Lieutenant Taylor's guidance, dispersed the crowd. Captain K. L. Garcia warned the club of potential license issues. Sergeant M. N. Patterson and Sergeant O. P. Stone issued citations to instigators. By 5:00 AM, the situation was under control. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Roberts Jr, Det. Williams, Det. Nelson OPERATIONS Lt. Taylor AFFIDAVIT - Noise Complaint Report 1) Club License 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) CCTV from Club 5) Bar Tab Details (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE T. Mitchell N.C.P.D. 33.135 P76 3575 Thompson, NEIL NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 195-3875 DETECTIVE: C. ROBERTS ITEM: 76-5600- 110 CRIME: 03:55 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 84605 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 10/30/24 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. C. D. Roberts  Officer Context: On April 7, DET. C. D. Roberts responded to a noise complaint at the Nightshade Club. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. E. F. Taylor  Officer Context: Lt. E. F. Taylor - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective G. H. Williams  Officer Context: Detective G. H. Williams and Detective I. J. Nelson arrived to mediate. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective I. J. Nelson  Officer Context: Detective G. H. Williams and Detective I. J. Nelson arrived to mediate. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Oliver  Officer Context: Statement. Technician Oliver recorded the scene. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Roberts  Officer Context: By 4:30 AM, Detectives Roberts, Williams, and Nelson, with Lieutenant Taylor's guidance, dispersed the crowd. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Williams  Officer Context: By 4:30 AM, Detectives Roberts, Williams, and Nelson, with Lieutenant Taylor's guidance, dispersed the crowd. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Nelson  Officer Context: By 4:30 AM, Detectives Roberts, Williams, and Nelson, with Lieutenant Taylor's guidance, dispersed the crowd. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain K. L. Garcia  Officer Context: Captain K. L. Garcia warned the club of potential license issues. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant M. N. Patterson  Officer Context: Sergeant M. N. Patterson and Sergeant O. P. Stone issued citations to instigators. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant O. P. Stone Officer Context: Sergeant M. N. Patterson and Sergeant O. P. Stone issued citations to instigators. Officer Role: Sergeant
